title: Free-body diagram - box at rest on incline

content.question: At the instant shown in the figure, a string attached to a box on an inclined surface is pulling straight up on the box. There is negligible friction between the box and the surface. Which of the following free-body diagrams best indicates the direction of the forces exerted on the box at the instant shown in the figure?

choices.label: The figure shows a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a dot. The first arrow is long, labeled F sub T, and extends vertically upward. The second arrow is long, labeled F sub N, and extends upward and to the right. The third arrow is long, labeled F sub g, and extends downward and to the right.
